channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14210] Create test for cell level ACLs involving user group
item.description:
Currently we have TestCellACLs and TestCellACLWithMultipleVersions which exercise cell level ACLs for users.

However, test for cell level ACLs involving user group is missing.

This issue is to add such test(s)
item.summary: Create test for cell level ACLs involving user group

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Attached patch for adding test coverage for cell level ACLs involving user group.
Please review.

Planning to add test coverage for ACLs with default value(true) for hbase.security.access.early_out, in a separate jira if it sounds good.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12750481/HBASE-14210.patch
against master branch at commit f2a9dab30eb339c86222db47430f18f7abf405c2.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12750481

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 8 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.0 2.4.1 2.5.0 2.5.1 2.5.2 2.6.0 2.7.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 1 warning messages.

+1 checkstyle. The applied patch does not increase the total number of checkstyle errors

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn post-site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.TestProcessBasedCluster
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestImportExport
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.procedure.TestWALProcedureStoreOnHDFS

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15099//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15099//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15099//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Javadoc warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15099//artifact/patchprocess/patchJavadocWarnings.txt
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15099//console

This message is automatically generated.

Tests failures not related to the patch.
Tests modified in this patch has passed.

Tests run: 2, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 22.871 sec - in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestCellACLs

Tests run: 8, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 64.048 sec - in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestCellACLWithMultipleVersions

Thanks for your work, Ashish.


+    for (String user : users)

+      perms.put(user, new Permission(action));

Either move the second line to end of first line or, add curly braces for the second line.


+            // with rw ACL for "user1", "user2" and "group"

"group" -> "@group"

Thanks for the review, Ted.
Addressed the comments in v1 patch.

Some more review comments after finishing a support call.


-            d.deleteColumns(TEST_FAMILY1, TEST_Q1);

-            d.deleteColumns(TEST_FAMILY1, TEST_Q2);

+            d.deleteFamily(TEST_FAMILY1);

Is the above change needed for user1 ?


+    verfifyUserDeniedForWrite(USER_OTHER, ONE);

Typo in method name above.

Is the above change needed for user1 ?

If you apply the patch, you will find that user1 code is still as it is with no change, the diff has come out in some confusing way.

Typo in method name above.

I will update this later, based on others review comments if they review it.
Thanks.

This message is automatically generated.

Patch lgtm overall. Some minor nits:

The name usersAndGroups is a bit misleading as it only covers USER_OTHER

May be, you can use user.getShortName in the fail message.


-            fail("user2 can not do the delete");

+            fail(user + " can not do the delete");

Any chance of changing the variable name of permsU2_GUandOwner?

Thanks Srikanth for the review.

The name usersAndGroups is a bit misleading as it only covers USER_OTHER

It also adds a group.


usersAndGroups = new String[] { USER_OTHER.getShortName(), AuthUtil.toGroupEntry(GROUP) };

May be, you can use user.getShortName in the fail message.

Will do in my next patch.

Any chance of changing the variable name of permsU2_GUandOwner?

Any suggestion what can be a good name, I am bad at this stuff.
w.r.t. the variable name of permsU2_GUandOwner, how about permsU2andGUandOwner ?
Updated patch to use user.getShortName in the fail message and renamed the variables of kind permsU2_GUandOwner as per Ted's suggestion.

+1 lgtm. Thanks, Ashish!

Ted Yu Are you planning to commit the patch?
+1 on patch.

I ran TestCellACLs and TestCellACLWithMultipleVersions with patch for branch-1 which passed.

The other test failures were not related to the patch since only the above tests were changed.
I've got some time free for committing this, let me do it today.
Please go ahead. Thanks!
I tried to apply the v3 master patch but there was one reject in TestCellACLWithMultipleVersions and 3 rejects in TestCellACLs. Please update and we can try again.
Oops, never mind, I was off on an unnamed ref somewhere. Let me switch to master and try again.
Pushed to 0.98 and up. New units and all tests in o.a.h.h.security.access.* passed on all branches.
